Name: Kousagi Ramen
Description: A subsidiary of Usagi, but less frequented.

Name: Marucho
Description: Soba noodle soup

Name: Soupless Tantanmen Piriri Akihabara Store
Description: Mapo tofu tantanmen

Name: Akashiyaki Tsukasa
Description: Akashiyaki (a type of takoyaki without sauce, meant to be dipped in dashi)

Name: cafe dalcomhada
Description: Pastries in the shape of animals (including the famous lemon duck cake)

Name: Shiodome
Description: Animals

Name: PAPABUBBLE パパブブレ
Description: Fresh handmade candy shop

Name: Tsukemen Gonokami Seisakusho Shinjuku
Description: Tsukemen with shrimp broth
Commentary: best tsukemen of my life

Name: Nashimura coffee
Description: European-style tea room
Commentary: Excellent pastries and a calm atmosphere

Name: Kobe beef steak Tramatsu no nikutarashi
Description: Small restaurant serving certified Kobe beef
Commentary: Excellent meat and a little cheaper than elsewhere

Name: K-books Namba-ichibankan
Description: Manga and weeb merch shop in the heart of Denden
Commentary: A great place to find old VTuber merch and second-hand merchandise.

Name: Nipponbashi Denden Town
Description: Osaka's electronics and geek district. Equivalent to Tokyo's Akihabara.

Name: Osaka Castle
Description: Famous castle dating from 1597, rebuilt since, with gardens and a museum with varied exhibitions.

Name: Nakanoshima Park
Description: Osaka's first public park, founded in 1891, includes a library, a rose garden, and a ceramics museum.

Name: Minoo Waterfall
Description: A 33-meter waterfall surrounded by deciduous trees, with an easy hiking trail and numerous benches.

Name: Hoshida Park
Description: A 100-hectare park with a 280-meter-long suspension bridge 50 meters high.

Name: National Museum of Art
Description: Underground art museum with souvenir shop, showcasing works by renowned artists on various media.

Name: Katsura Hanare かつら はなれ
Description: Kaiseki restaurant (traditional dinner)

Name: Shitennoji
Description: Restored Buddhist temple built in 593, with a 5-level pagoda, statues and ponds populated with turtles.

Name: Parks Garden
Description: Architecturally interesting

Name: Kaiyukan Aquarium
Description: One of the world's largest aquariums, home to arctic and tropical aquatic species.

Name: Sennichimae Doguyasuji Shopping Street for cookware
Description: Shopping street dedicated to the sale of household products, kitchen utensils, pottery and tools.
Commentary: A very good place to buy kitchen knives

Name: Jungle Fantastic Machinery Museum Mecha Store
Description: Store specializing in mecha merchandise

Name: Kasuga-taisha
Description: Temple of a Thousand Lanterns

Name: Shin Yakushi-ji
Description: Eighth-century Buddhist temple housing statues of the Twelve Heavenly Generals.

Name: Mugen Ramen
Description: Generous ramen in meat

Name: Dontaku Doyama
Description: Okonomiyaki restaurant serving Hiroshima and classic versions

Name: Katsudon Yoshibei Sannomiya Honten
Description: One of Kobe's best Katsudon

Name: Uobei Abikoten
Description: Conveyor belt sushi restaurant chain with meat sushi options
Restaurant chain founded by a former rikishi, specializing in huge pieces of katsu
